intro: Nasa poissoniana subsp. poissoniana, commonly known as the pink fairy tern, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It has palmate leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
